title: Letters from Thomas Percy, D.D. :
snippet: K. David 1st grants to the canons " one of his milns of Dene with the tenths of his milns of Libberton and Dene, and those of his new miln of Edwynesburg and Craggensmark as far as they appertained to him, with all that belonged to Vineth White on the said rock, (to be held in free and perpetual alms.)" This rock, at the bottom of which the said new mill stood, and where there still continues a mill for grain, I think is that romantic precipice below the other mills of Dene which looks down the river upon the again famous mineral well of St Bernard, where the goddess of health is now fixed in her temple.
